page.title: 02The Stocks in Breamore
page.content: Unobtrusively sited along the busy main road from Ringwood to Salisbury,Breamore stocks are easy to miss.Road widening has recently necessitated moving the stocks a few hundred yards from their original site. Village records show the existence of stocks here in the late 16th c.,but they probably had been used since Medieval times by the Lord of the Manor for the punishment of lesser offences.It is likely,too,that a {whipping post}and{pillory}were also found nearby,and perhaps a ducking-stool for gossips at the marsh. Made of perishable wood,the stocks have had to be frequently renewed. Village records contain accounts rendered for their repair or replacement by the village carpenter.
